# Writing Your First Java Program ðŸ’»

Create a simple file HelloWorld.java with a basic class and a main method that prints 'Hello, World!'.

## Understanding the Code ðŸ§©

- public class HelloWorld {} - *The class declaration* that must match your filename
- public static void main(String[] args) {} - *The entry point* of your program
- System.out.println("Hello, World!"); - *The print statement* that outputs text to console

## Steps to Run the Program â–¶

1. **Save as HelloWorld.java** - Make sure filename matches class name exactly
2. *Compile using javac* - Run javac HelloWorld.java in terminal
3. *Run using java command* - Execute java HelloWorld (no .java extension)

## Common Beginner Mistakes âš 

- *Filename mismatch* - HelloWorld.java must contain a class named HelloWorld
- *Missing braces* - Each opening { needs a closing }
- *Case sensitivity* - Java is case-sensitive! String â‰  string
- *Incorrect main method signature* - Must be public static void main(String[] args)
